title: Pride Of Britain Awards: Binky Felstead wears red evening gown
text:
On a busy red carpet it was Binky Felstead who caught the eye as she attended the annual Pride of Britain Awards on Monday night.

The former Made In Chelsea star caught the eye in a vibrant crimson gown as she posed for photos shortly after arriving at London's Grosvenor House Hotel ahead of the star-studded event.

With a fitted detail the dress drew attention to her slender physique as she mingled with guests outside the upmarket venue.

Looking good: On a busy red carpet it was Binky Felstead who caught the eye as she attended the annual Pride of Britain Awards on Monday night

Adding to a recurring colour scheme, the TV personality opted for vibrant red lipstick, while deft touches of foundation and eyeliner drew further attention to her features.

Binky was enjoying a rare night away from daughter India, her only child with former boyfriend Josh 'JP' Patterson - but it was all for a good cause.

More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars will come together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

Hard to miss: The former Made In Chelsea star caught the eye in a vibrant crimson gown as she posed for photos shortly after arriving at London's Grosvenor House Hotel

Stunning: With a fitted detail the dress drew attention to her slender physique as she mingled with guests outside the upmarket venue

The awards recognise and celebrate ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Hosted by Carol Vorderman, celebrities and public figures including Prince Charles, Robert Downey Jr, Sir Ben Kingsley, Dua Lipa, Ant & Dec, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Adam Lambert, Christine Lampard, Sir Michael Caine, Jonathan Ross, Suranne Jones, and the judges and casts of Strictly Come Dancing and X Factor will be honouring this year's awe-inspiring winners.

Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started.

'In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us.

'I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will be broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm.
